titleproper.value:
Guide to the Christopher D'Arcangelo Papers
                    <lb/>1965-2003(bulk 1975-1978)
                    <lb/>
                    <num>MSS 264</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Lisa Darms with Lawrence Giffin, 2009.

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2016-01-29T17:13-0500</date>

p.value: Access copies of media may not be available to researchers at this time.

Published citations should take the following form:
                <lb/>
                <lb/> Identification of item, date (if known); Christopher D'Arcangelo Papers; MSS 264; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

Christopher Dâ€™Arcangelo, an artist working during the 1970's, was born in 1955 and died in 1979. In 1975 he performed unauthorized pieces at New York's Whitney Museum, Museum of Modern Art, Guggenheim Museum, and the Metropolitan Museum, and in 1976 at the Norton Simon Museum in Pasadena, CA. In January 1977, LAICA published his proposal "LAICA as an Alternative to Museums". Christopher was also a carpenter and contractor, and in September of 1977 he began work on functional constructions. During 1978 he performed unauthorized pieces at the Louvre in Paris and the Rosa Esman Gallery in New York City. Christopher also took part in an exhibition at Artists Space in New York City in 1978; from 1976 until his death, he was working on a proposal for the Van Abbe Museum in Eindhoven.
<emph render="bold">Series IV: Media</emph> consists of video, audio, and film elements. Access copies may not be available for research use at this time.

Created at request of D'Arcangelo, these documents record what Cathy Weiner witnessed during the 1975 pieces at the Whitney Museum of American Art, The Museum of Modern Art, and the Guggenheim Museum.

 Work Binder A A General note

Binder A is a similar recreation of the binder that D'Arcangelo created to document his artmaking; it was assembled by the D'Arcangelo Family Partnership.

 Work Binder B B General note

Binder B is a partial recreation of the binder that D'Arcangelo created to document his artmaking, as well as other documents assembled by the D'Arcangelo Family Partnership.

 Series II: Posthumous Files 1978-1998 Subseries A: General Articles about D'Arcangelo 4 1 1991, 1996, 1998 Articles/Reviews 4 2 1979; undated Chronologies and Inventories 4 3 undated General note

Inlcudes Christopher D'Arcangelo Chronology, created by Gideon D'Arcangelo 1993, updated 2009.

 Copies of D'Arcangelo Notebook 4 4 undated Copies of Work 4 5 undated Correspondence about D'Arcangelo Works 4 6 1979, 1988, 1992, 1995, undated Greene Naftali 4 7 undated Bruce Hainley 4 8 undated Journal: Southern California Art Magazine No. 23 4 9 June-July 1979 List of Cathy Weiner's photographs of D'Arcangelo Work 4 10 undated Oehlen Williams 95 Catalog 4 11 1995 Recent works and notes on six series - Peter Nadin 4 12 1992 Subseries B: Algus Greenspon Homage Scope and Content

This subseries contains files documenting the Christopher D'Arcangelo Homage, an exhibition held at Algus Greenspon Gallery in October 2011. Researchers who had accessed the Christopher D'Arcangelo Papers at the Fales Library were invited to respond to his work and their experiences working with D'Arcangelo's Papers. Exhibition attendees were also invited to respond.
